subject: Re: [junit] Re: Any plans to revamp junit?
msgSnippet: ... Depends on the seriousness of the problem.  Sure, you can rely on everyone to implement workarounds or their own fixes (e.g. testrunners), but what s the
messageBody:
On Jul 13, 2004, at 7:07 AM, Ilja Preuss wrote:

> Bill de hSra wrote:
>> J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>
>>> How many such fixes are there, though, really? There's the
>>> classloader fix, and the string compares fix, and other than that,
>>> everything else is merely an extension, isn't it? (I'm talking about
>>> DbUnit, HtmlUnit, HttpUnit, XMLUnit, ...)
>>
>> How many is a red herring.
>
> Is it? If there aren't many fixes that needed to be integrated, how
> much
> of a problem is it?

Depends on the seriousness of the problem. Sure, you can rely on
everyone to implement workarounds or their own fixes (e.g.
testrunners), but what's the point? Why leave the broken things broken
at all?

I don't see how bug fixes have anything at all to do with featuritis.
To me it simply seems that the SF project is dead (certainly no one
seems to be managing bug reports, even if the RFE forum is considered a
bit bucket).
